channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15607] Remove PB references from Admin for 2.0
item.description: This is a sub-task for HBASE-15174.
item.summary: Remove PB references from Admin for 2.0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: For this JIRA should we deprecate the APIs that we are changing in 1.3 and 1.4 releases and in 2.0 just update the APIs in the way we want?
Ya those are user exposed APIs.

Patch for trunk. Based on this patch I will update the patch for the SnapshotExceptions related changes because the POJO that is created here will be helpful for that JIRA also. Initial version of the patch for feedback. Covers all the protos in the Admin area. Let me try QA.
Oops there is one more thing to be covered.

Updated patch. This handles everything.
Some points that am not sure
What should be the default value of SnapShotDescription's creation time and version? For now I have just used -1. May be need to change them. Also if there is a -1 being returned from that POJO will there be an impact in the Snapshot Desc that is getting serialized I need to see. Others are straightforward.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

MasterProtos.SnapshotResponse takeSnapshotAsync

This is not changed


if (response.getCompactionState() != null) {

2265	        return Admin.CompactionState.valueOf(response.getCompactionState().toString());

2266	      }

We can keep this conversion of PB object to our POJO (and reverse) in PBUtil?

We need keep the POJOs within Admin or can it be outside?

MasterProtos.SnapshotResponse takeSnapshotAsync

The _1 patch already changes it. Just made the return type void.

We can keep this conversion of PB object to our POJO (and reverse) in PBUtil?

Ya we can do it I believe. Let me see.

We need keep the POJOs within Admin or can it be outside?

There was already one POJO exposed in Admin so followed the same way.
Can we have the new POJOs go as individual classes not inlined in Admin. Almost all of the client-facing APIs that are similar are top-level classes.
I will check the failed test cases and address the comments later next week. Thanks for the reviews.

I see Admin is marked

@InterfaceStability.Evolving

... so some leeway here.

The changes will make it so a 1.2 client will not be able to get the state of a compaction nor do a snapshot using a snapshot description (they will be able to do a snapshot using table name) nor run a snapshot async, or list snapshots.

I'd be fine with that. Needs to be in release notes as incompatible change.
Patch LGTM (after it gets consideration of Anoop Sam John and Enis Soztutar review). See my note above suggesting what should be noted in release note.

Updated patch. Moved all the existing MasterSwitchType and CompactionType also to individual classes. Hence the patch has become much bigger. Will wait for QA.
For the branch-1 and branch-1.3 will prepare a patch deprecating these methods and the static inner classes.

-1 overall
